name: Morita Shougi
overview: Morita Shougi is a Famicom adaption of the Japanese board game "Shougi", which plays similar to chess. It is the second Shougi game released for the Nintendo Famicom in Japan. The game lets you choose from a couple of game modes. You can play a game against another human player or a CPU player which comes in three different difficulty levels. The game also gives you extensive editing options, giving you the opportunity to create a board setup of your liking, placing the Shōgi pieces wherever you want. The game also lets a player interrupt a current game and go back and forth through the moves.
